login_error_invalid_user_disable_login:

 Try again in {{minutes}} minute(s) {{seconds}} second(s).
wireless_page_input_guide_when_hide_ssid: If the Hide SSID is enabled, WPS function is inactivated.

advanced_dmz_page_error_duplicate_lan_ip: The IP address is the same as LAN IP address. Enter another IP address.
common_text_invalid_wep_hexa_pattern: Password contains a number or letter other than 0.

advanced_ddns_wol_error_duplicate_mac_ad: This MAC Address already exists in the WoL list.

advanced_ddns_wol_humaxdns_remote_access: *Check your Remote Access setting. If the remote access is on, you can access remotely with the address
advanced_ddns_wol_invalid_hostname_msg_b: Enter a combination of letters and numbers.
advanced_ddns_wol_invalid_hostname_msg: Invalid host name. Enter a-z, A-Z, 0-9 and – (Hyphen) only.
advanced_ddns_wol_invalid_hostname_msg_b: Invalid host name. Cannot contain the –(hyphen) at the front or end.

common_text_wireless_duplicated_ssid: The Network Name(SSID) already exists. Enter another Network Name(SSID).
lan_dhcp_off_message: If you turn off the DHCP server, your network devices may be disconnected. Continue?
error_lan_ip_is_between_start_end_ip: LAN IP address must be outside DHCP range. Change the LAN IP Address or DHCP Start/End Address.

In order to complete the setup of the system must be restart.
common_text_phone_not_used_during_reboot: The phone cannot be used during the reboot.
network_internet_page_card_text_confirm_: After restarting, move to new LAN IP Address  ({{address}}). Continue?
error_start_ip_duplicate_lan_ip: Enter another IP address. Can not same as the LAN IP address.
error_start_end_ip_range_less_than_min_2: The DHCP range is too small. The minimum range is at least 32.
error_start_end_ip: Start IP address must be smaller than End IP address.
wireless_schedule_sub_description_2: of the router. Wireless Schedule is to turn off the wireless network at the time you set.
advanced_port_forwarding_page_duplicate_: This Local Port/External Port already exists.
advanced_port_forwarding_page_same_port_: The number of Local Ports must be the same as that of External Ports.
advanced_network_page_card_not_use_remot: This port is not available. Enter another Port number.
page_error_invalid_lan_gateway_address: Invalid Gateway Address. The Gateway Address must be in the same subnet as that of the current WAN IP Address.
common_ui_alphanumeric_subnet_mask_error: The Subnet Mask format is invalid.

Restarting the system...
Takes about a few minute.
change_pass_success_confirm: The password has been changed.</br> Do you want to log in again?
error_old_password_does_not_match: The old password does not match.
advanced_port_triggering_page_duplicate_: The Triggered/Forward Port already exists in the Port Triggering list.
advanced_port_triggering_page_sub_title: You can configure port triggering to allow access to specific service ports in a secure manner.
advanced_rip_page_sub_title: You can set the routing information protocol and manage the routed subnet and route subnet list.
advanced_route_card_duplicate_entry: Duplicated entry found in static route.
management_date_time_guide_msg: *This region does not observe Daylight Saving Time
wireless_page_same_primary_error_message: The same SSID cannot be used between the Primary Wireless and Guest Wireless.
wireless_page_same_guest_error_message: The same SSID cannot be used with the same Guest Wireless frequency.
advanced_wireless_page_confirm_turn_off_: You cannot use 2.4GHz wireless network. Continue?
advanced_wireless_page_text_content: RSSI (Received Signal Strength Indication) is a common name for the signal strength in a wireless network environment. RSSI is an indication of the power level being received by the antenna. Therefore, the higher the RSSI value is, the stronger the signal is.
advanced_wireless_text_restore_default: Do you want to restore to default wireless settings?
management_factory_reset_guide: *When you perform ‘Factory Reset’, all settings are initialized. The ‘Backup’ feature saves the current setting as a file and the ‘Restore’ feature restores the current setting.
management_factory_reset_confirm:
Do you want to reset all settings to the factory default?
We recommend that you back up your last settings if you want to restore them.
management_factory_reset_confirm_highlig: And the phone cannot be used during the reboot.
management_factory_reset_warning: Restoring to factory default settings. Do not turn off or press the reset button.
management_back_up_confirm: Do you want to back up the current setting file?
management_back_up_successed: Backup has completed. The file name is '{{filename}}'.
management_restore_confirm: Do you want to restore to the selected file? Restart the system to apply the changes.
management_restore_failed: System restore has failed. Try again.
management_restore_message_restore_corru: Error is detected on the backup file.
management_restart_confirm:
Do you want to restart the system? 
It take about a few minutes to restart.
system_menu_text_confirm_reboot_1:
Do you want to restart the system? 
It take about a few minutes to restart and
management_firmware_up_to_date: The current version is up to date.
management_firmware_avaiable:
New firmware is available.
New Firmware Version : {{version}}
If you want to update, press the Update button below.
management_firmware_invalid_file: Invalid file to update. Check the update file.
management_firmware_confirm_upgrade_firm: Do you want to update the firmware? </br> During the update process, the network connection may be temporarily disconnected.
management_firmware_choose_firmware_msg_: The latest firmware through the server.
management_firmware_updating_firmware_ms: Updating firmware may take a few minutes.
Do not turn off the power or press the reset button.
management_firmware_message_error_upgrad: Update has failed due to unknown error.
advanced_wireless_page_confirm_turn_off_: You cannot use 5GHz wireless network. Continue?
management_firmware_with_mandatory_heade:
New firmware is available in the ACS Server.
The new firmware will be updated as required.
management_firmware_with_mandatory_foote: The system will start updating firmware in 10 seconds.
management_firmware_without_mandatory_fo: Do you want to update the firmware?
wireless_wps_page_content_wpsubutton_con:
If your client device has a WPS (Wi-Fi Protected Setup) button, press the WPS button on both devices within 2 minutes to connect them. 
You can see the operating status on the LED of your product or a message below.
The WPS button works only when Security is None, WPA2-PSK, WPA2/WPA-PSK and WPA2-PSK/WPA3-SAE. Check the security type of 2.4GHz, 5GHz-1 and 5GHz-2
If Hide SSIDs on all of the wireless networks are set to on, WPS is disabled.
management_wizard_welcome_guide_text_1: Edit your settings to optimize your network environment and configure various functions just in 4 steps.
management_wizard_welcome_guide_text_2: The {{modelName}} Web UI is designed as a reactive web, allowing users to access the web UI without having to install a separate app. You can access our Web UI with just a single web URL via your PC, mobile phone or any kinds of devices.
network_lan_page_reserved_error_duplicat: Enter another IP address. Cannot same as the LAN IP address.
page_error_duplicate_lan_ip_address:
The Destination IP address cannot be the same as the gateway address. 
 Enter another address.
management_wizard_wireless_password_tool: You can change the password setting between 8 and 63 characters (letters, numbers and special characters). The default security type is WPA2-PSK/WPA3-SAE Mixed. If you want to change the security type, go to Wireless > Primary Wireless after completing the wizard.
ddns_connection_status_other: Please check to your service provider.
advanced_port_forwarding_page_same_port_: The range of Local Ports and External Ports must be the same.
parental_control_create_parental_control: Create a 4 digit parental code. </br>You can set a parental code to restrict access to the parental control feature.
parental_control_login_dialogue_descript: If you forgot the parental code, refer to the support on website.
management_operation_mode_router_mode_gu: In router mode, your router connects to the internet via Dynamic IP, Static IP, PPPoE, PPTP or L2TP and shares a wired or wireless network. The NAT, DHCP server are enabled.
management_operation_mode_bridge_mode_gu: In Bridge mode, your router wired to the host router to extend the wireless coverage. However, Mesh Mode are not supported even if they are connected to HUMAX High-Performance product
management_operation_mode_router_confirm: Do you want to change the operation mode? It will take a few minutes to restart the system and you can access the new assigned IP address after the restart.
management_operation_mode_extender_confi: Do you want to change the operation mode? It will take a few minutes to restart the system and you can access the http://dearmyextender.net after the restart.
simple_internet_page_dual_wan_card_secon: Secondary WAN is turned off. If you want to use it, please go to the Advanced > Secondary WAN and turn on Secondary WAN.
service_port_forwarding_external_port_pr: This External Port and Protocol already exist.
security_check_password_tooltip_password: Combining a password with numbers, symbols, capital letters and lowercase letters enhances the security level
security_check_password_tooltip_not_chan: If you change your password regularly, the security level will be enhanced
common_text_the_same_lan_ip: Enter another IP address. Cannot be same as the LAN IP address.
common_ui_dialog_auto_logged_out: Automatically logs out after 20 minutes of inactivity.
common_ui_dialog_configuration_changes_r: Configuration changes require the system to restart. Continue?
management_operation_mode_router_mesh_mo: Select this mode to use the router as the
security_vpn_server_openvpn_change_confi: The OpenVPN configuration file has been changed. Download the OpenVPN cofig file again.
mac_filtering_confirm_change_black_to_wh: If you change from Black Mode to White Mode, Blacklist will be erased. Continue? * White Mode works when you register one or more items in the list. To use as White mode, please press [add] button to register.
mac_filtering_confirm_change_white_to_bl: If you change from White Mode to Black Mode, Whitelist will be erased. Continue?
error_new_password_same_as_current: The new password is the same as the current password.
advanced_text_eco_mode_led_eco_mode: *LED Eco Mode and Thermal Protection Mode cannot be used at the same time.
advanced_text_eco_mode_in_led_eco_mode: *In LED Eco Mode, the speed of the LAN 4 port is limited to 1Gbps.
advanced_text_eco_mode_in_thermal_protec: * When Thermal Protection is running, the speed of the LAN 4 port is limited to 1Gbps.
setup_password_page_description_1: Setup the login password to prevent unauthorized access to Web UI.
setup_password_page_description_2: We recommend you write down your new password.
advanced_wireless_ap_scan_error_title_df: Cannot scan 5GHz wireless radio, because using the DFS channel.
generate_qr_code_note: ※ QR Code is provided for easy Wi-Fi connection. Press the [QR Code Generation] button to generate a QR code, scan it through the mobile’s camera, you can directly access the Wi-Fi.
common_wireless_radio_turn_off_message_n:
Wireless {{interface}} is turned off.
If you want to use it, please go to the Wireless > Basic Setting and turn on Radio
advanced_wireless_ap_scan_checking_dfs_c: Checking for DFS channels. Please try again in a few minutes.
management_wizard_change_password_guide_: Change the login password for security. For the default login password see the label of the product.
The new login password will be applied to the next login.
login_info_text:
For the default Password see the label of the product.
If you changed the Login Password, enter the changed Password.
help_wireless_content_guide: You can configure various wirless settings. Click the menu below for help in wireless setting.(Note: Wireless network is not available when 'Off' is enable in Advanced Settings> Wireless Settings.)
help_menu_content_guide: Help provides guide messages for each menu. Select the menu for which you want to see help.
help_common_go_to_current_page: Go to the help of current page
service_port_forwarding_single_port_valu: The Local Ports and External Ports must be the same.
wireless_page_same_primary_and_secondary: The same SSID cannot be used between the Primary Wireless and Secondary Wireless.
wireless_page_same_secondary_error_messa: The same SSID cannot be used with the same Secondary Wireless frequency.
eco_mode_type_led_lighting: Mode 2: LAN 4 Port 1Gbps & LED Eco Lighting
eco_mode_type_specific_time: Mode 3: LAN 4 Port 1Gbps at specific time
eco_mode_type_speed_limit_message: ※ In Eco Mode, the speed of the LAN 4 port is limited to 1Gbps.
eco_mode_type_led_lighting_message: ※ The speed of LAN 4 Port is limited to 1Gbps and Power lamp(lights orange) and lights off except Phone 1&2 lamp.
eco_mode_type_specific_time_message: ※ The speed of LAN 4 port is limited to 1Gbps from July to September from 10:00 to 15:00.
wireless_primary_wireless_band_steering_: When Band steering is On, SSIDs of 2.4GHz and 5GHz operate as one. (2.4GHz, 5GHz cannot be modified respectively). Continue?

Band Steering is on .
If you want to use it, please go to the Band Steering tab and set to Off the Band Steering.
management_operation_mode_router_mesh_mo: Select this mode to use the router as the
Then the routers will reboot and be ready to connect. Press the WPS buttons of the both routers to connect. Enjoy the seamless mesh network!
allows you to experience the strongest and seamless performance in your network environment
management_operation_mode_extender_mesh_: In Extender (mesh) mode, your router wirelessly connects to the host router to extend the wireless coverage. To use the mesh mode, press the WPS button on both routers at the same time.
allows you to experience the strongest and seamless performance in your network environment
usb_text_guide_promotion_message: Media Share allows you to share files stored in the connected USB device through the internet.
help_firmware_update_text_description: Perform a firmware update or view the current firmware version.
help_firmware_update_manual_update_guide: Manual Update: You can manually update the firmware if you have the firmware update file. Upload the firmware update file using the file explorer and click the [Update] button.
help_firmware_update_model_name_guide: Model Name: Displays the model name of the router.
help_firmware_update_current_version_gui: Current Version: Displays the current firmware version.
help_firmware_update_build_time_guide: Build Time: Displays the build time of the current firmware.
help_log_analysis_text_description: This feature allows you to view the system log of the router. Click the refresh icon on the right to view updated result of the log analysis.
help_log_analysis_date_time_guide: Date/Time: Displays the date and time of the log. Click the arrow to display the list by ascending or descending order.
help_log_analysis_log_type_guide: Log Type: Select the type of log. You can select one from “General,” “Security,” and “Wireless.”
help_log_analysis_result_guide: Result: Displays the information of the selected log type.
help_log_analysis_delete_button_guide: You can click the [Clear] button to delete the currently displayed log information.
help_factory_reset_text_description: Initialize router settings or restart the router.
help_factory_reset_guide: Factory Reset: Restore the router settings back to the default settings. Click the button to proceed.
help_factory_reset_backup_guide: Backup: Save the current settings as a file. Click the button to proceed.
help_factory_reset_restore_guide: Restore: Restore the saved settings from the backup file. Proceed after uploading the backup file using the file explorer.
help_factory_reset_restart_guide: Restart: Restart the router. Click the button to proceed.
help_eco_mode_text_description: This feature allows you to control the router’s LED indicator operation.
help_eco_mode_type_guide: Eco Mode Type: Select an Eco Mode Type.
help_eco_mode_type_mode_1_guide: - Mode 1: LAN 4 Port 1Gbps (Speed limit) - At the set schedule time, the speed of LAN 4 port is limited to 1Gbps.
help_eco_mode_type_mode_2_guide: - Mode 2: LAN 4 Port 1Gbps & LED Eco Lighting - The power lamp ignites green, and all lamps except the phone 1 and 2 lamps are turned off at the set schedule time.
help_eco_mode_type_mode_3_guide: - Mode 3: LAN 4 Port 1Gbps at specific time - Limits the speed of the LAN 4 port to 1 Gbps from July to September from 10:00 to 15:00.
help_eco_mode_led_guide: ※ LED means rear port, and lamp means status LED on the front.
help_eco_mode_schedule_mode_description: The LED indicators operate according to the set schedule. (Example: The LED indicators operate from 10 pm to 5 am (for 7 hours) if the time has been set from 22:00 to 5:00.)
help_change_password_text_description: Change password on a regular basis to maintain system security.
help_change_password_new_password_guide: New Password: Enter a new password. Enter 6 – 64 characters for the password.
help_change_password_new_password_again_: Retype New Password : Enter the new password again. The password must be between 6 – 64 characters.
help_date_time_text_description: Set time and date for router operation. The router fetches the date and time information from the NTP server once it is connected to the Internet. Otherwise, the most recent synchronization time or the firmware’s build time is used for the router’s operation.
help_date_time_time_zone_guide: Time Zone: Select a time zone. Use of daytime saving (DST) will be specified for some regions. For those regions where daytime saving is applied, you can choose whether or not to apply it.
help_date_time_ntp_server_guide: NTP Server List: Displays the list of NTP server addresses. You can modify/delete the list.
help_network_icmpv4_block_guide: WAN ICMPv4 Blocking: Enable or disable ICMPv4 ping blocking for the WAN. Enable this feature (set to “On”) to enhance the level of security by blocking ping packet attacks originating from the WAN.
help_network_icmpv6_block_guide: WAN ICMPv6 Blocking: Enable or disable ICMPv6 ping blocking for the WAN. Enable this feature (set to “On”) to enhance the level of security by blocking ping packet attacks originating from the WAN.
help_network_ipsec_guide: IPSec Passthrough: Enable or disable IPSec Passthrough.
help_network_pptp_guide: PPTP Passthrough: Enable or disable PPTP Passthrough.
help_network_l2tp_guide: L2TP Passthrough: Enable or disable L2TP Passthrough.
help_network_tcp_timer_guide: TCP Timer: Enter the effective retention time (seconds) of the IP address / port number dynamic conversion table when using the NAPT / SPI function. You can enter a value between 30 and 432000 (seconds). (Common for IPv4 / IPv6)
help_network_udp_timer_guide: UDP Timer: Enter the effective retention time (seconds) of the IP address / port number dynamic conversion table when using the NAPT / SPI function. You can enter a value between 30 and 3600 (seconds). (Common for IPv4 / IPv6)
help_wireless_text_description: Configure various advanced features related to the wireless network.
help_wireless_24g_text_description: Configure advanced settings for 2.4GHz wireless network. (*Do not change default settings unless it is necessary.)
help_wireless_5g_text_description: Detailed setting information is identical to those for the 2.4GHz wireless settings.
help_wireless_radio_guide: Radio: Enable or disable the wireless network. (*Wireless features for the frequency band will not be available if it is set to “Off.”)
help_wireless_channel_guide: Channel: Set the channel for the wireless network. Set it to “Auto” to automatically select the optimal channel (recommended). Click the icon (!) on the right to view the channel that is in use.
help_wireless_ap_list_guide: APs: Button to search for the AP information for the wireless network. Click the button the view the nearby APs that are available.
help_wireless_802_guide: 802.11 Mode: Set 802.11 mode. Set it to “Mixed” mode to allow devices to connect via multiple connection modes (recommended).
help_wireless_sideband_guide: Sideband (2.4GHz only): Set the sideband. When using channels 5-9, you can select either the upper channel or lower channel when the bandwidth is set to 40MHz.
help_wireless_output_power_guide: Output Power: Select the intensity of the wireless signal. You can select one from “High,” “Medium,” and “Low.”
help_routing_text_description: This feature defines the route of data transmission to direct the data to a specific host or network. Set this feature to “On” to enable it.
help_routing_ipv4_status_guide: Status: Displays the status of routing operation.
help_routing_ipv4_destination_guide: Destination IP Address: Displays the destination IP address to which the routing rules apply.
help_routing_ipv4_subnet_guide: Subnet Mask: Displays the subnet mask to which the routing rules apply.
help_routing_ipv4_interface_guide: Interface: Displays the interface to which the routing rules apply.
help_routing_ipv4_gateway_guide: Gateway: Displays the gateway to which the routing rules apply.
help_routing_ipv4_edit_delete_guide: Edit/Delete: Edit or delete the rules on the list.
help_routing_ipv6_destination_guide: Destination IP Address / Prefix Length: Displays the destination IPv6 address and prefix length to which the routing rules apply.
help_routing_ipv6_link_local_addr_guide: Link Local Address: Displays the link local address to which the routing rules apply.
help_routing_ipv6_interface_guide: Interface: Displays the interface to which the routing rules apply.
help_routing_ipv6_edit_delete_guide: Edit/Delete: Edit or delete the rules on the list.
help_upnp_text_description: When a UPnP device is detected, this feature automatically adds the device to the network and performs port forwarding. (Caution! This feature can be vulnerable to security breaches because it allows the automatic connection of devices.) Set this feature to “On” to enable it.
help_upnp_notification_interval_guide: Notification Interval: Interval for broadcasting the router’s UPnP information. Shorter cycle increases the frequency of UPnP information broadcasting.
help_upnp_timetolive_guide: Time To Live: Set the effective duration of the computer or network data. UPnP packet of the router will be disposed of after the set number of hops.
help_upnp_port_mapping_description_text: You can click the refresh icon on the right to update the list.
help_upnp_port_mapping_description_guide: Description: Displays description about the UPnP service.
help_upnp_port_mapping_protocol_guide: Protocol: Displays the protocol for the UPnP service.
help_upnp_port_mapping_ip_addr_guide: IP Address: Displays the IP address for the UPnP service.
help_upnp_port_mapping_internal_port_gui: Internal Port: Displays the internal port for the UPnP service.
help_upnp_port_mapping_external_port_gui: External Port: Displays the external port for the UPnP service.
help_diagnostic_description_text: Use this feature to diagnose network status.
help_diagnostic_utility_guide: Utility: Select the type of diagnosis. Select either “Ping test” or “Traceroute.”
help_diagnostic_ping_test_description: The ping test verifies the network status by transmitting packets between specific IP addresses or domain names.
help_diagnostic_ping_test_target_ip_guid: Target IP Address/Domain Name: Enter the IP address or domain name to transmit ping packets.
help_diagnostic_ping_test_ping_size_guid: Ping Size: Enter the size of the ping packet. Available setting range is between 64 and 1518, and the default setting is 64.
help_diagnostic_ping_test_ping_count_gui: Ping Count: Enter the number of pings. The available setting range is between 1 and 256, and the default setting is 4.
help_diagnostic_ping_test_ping_interval_: Ping Interval: Enter the interval for transmitting pings. The available setting range is between 100 and 3600000, and the default setting is 1000.
help_diagnostic_button_description: Click the [Start] button to view the result below. You can click the [Delete] button to delete the result.
help_diagnostic_traceroute_description: The traceroute feature shows the route to reach the specified IP address or domain name, and whether or not the destination has been reached.
help_diagnostic_traceroute_destination_g: Target IP Address / Domain Name: Enter the IP address or domain name to transmit traceroute packets.
help_diagnostic_traceroute_traceroute_ma: Traceroute Maximum TTL: Set the maximum effective duration for the transmitted packets. The available setting range is between 1 and 30, and the default setting is 20.
help_packet_filtering_description_text: The IPv4 (or IPv6) packet filtering list is displayed for each target interface. You can configure a list of packet filtering conditions and delete the entries.
help_packet_filtering_priority_guide: Priority: Displays the priority of the IPv4 (or IPv6) filtering conditions.
help_packet_filtering_type_guide: Type: Set blocking / release for packets matching the filter condition.
help_packet_filtering_target_guide: Target Interface: Set the direction in which the set packet is delivered.
help_packet_filtering_protocol_guide: Protocol: Displays the type of IP protocol to be filtered.
help_packet_filtering_source_ip_guide: Source IP Address: Displays the source IP address of the packets to be filtered. “Any” is displayed if the filtering will be performed for packets originated from all IP address. “Localhost” is displayed if the filtering will be performed for packets from this product.
help_packet_filtering_source_port_guide: Source Port (Start – End): Displays the source port number of the packets to be filtered. “Any” is displayed if the filtering will be performed for packets from all port numbers.
help_packet_filtering_target_ip_guide: Destination IP Address: Displays the target IP address of the packets to be filtered. “Any” is displayed if the filtering will be performed for packets sent to all port numbers. “Localhost” is displayed if the filtering will be performed for packets sent to this product.
help_packet_filtering_target_port_guide: Destination Port (Start – End): Displays the target port number of the packets to be filtered. “Any” is displayed if the filtering will be performed for packets from all port numbers.
help_packet_filtering_edit_delete_guide: Edit/Delete: Edit or delete the selected IPv4 (or IPv6) filtering condition.
help_ddns_description_text: DDNS may be configured to link a specified domain name with a variable IP address in real time, which allows external users to access the router regardless of the changed IP address.
help_ddns_service_provider_guide: Service Provider: Select a service provider. You can select either “DynDNS” or “NoIP.” The setting items vary depending on the service provider you have selected.
help_ddns_user_name_guide: User Name: Enter the user name or account name for the service you have selected.
help_ddns_password_guide: Password: Enter the password for the service you have selected.
help_ddns_domain_name_guide: Domain Name: Enter the domain name to be used. A DDNS address will be generated with the name you have entered.
help_ddns_connection_status_guide: Connection Status: Displays the connection status to the DDNS server.
help_ddns_status_update_success_guide: - DDNS Update Successful: The generated DDNS is available for use.
help_ddns_status_update_fail_guide: - DDNS Update Failed: The generated DDNS is not available for use.
help_ddns_status_duplicate_hostname_guid: - Duplicated Hostname: The host name is already in use. Enter another host name.
help_ddns_status_contact_service_provide: - Contact Service Provider: An error related to the service occurred. Contact your service provider for troubleshooting.
help_ddns_ip_addr_guide: IP Address: IP address for the DDNS.
help_ddns_link_guide: Use the following link to access the router anytime, anywhere.
help_port_forwarding_description_text: Port forwarding may be used to allow access by externally connected devices.
help_port_forwarding_on_off_guide: On/Off: Enable or disable the port forwarding rules on the list. Rules that are disabled (set to “Off”) will not be used.
help_port_forwarding_service_type_guide: Service Type: Displays the service for port forwarding.
help_port_forwarding_ip_addr_guide: IP Address: Displays the internal IP address of the devices for port forwarding.
help_port_forwarding_local_port_guide: Local Port (Start – End): Displays the internal ports that are selected.
help_port_forwarding_external_port_guide: External Port (Start – End): Displays the external ports that are selected.
help_port_forwarding_edit_delete_guide: Edit/Delete: Edit or delete the port forwarding rules on the list.
help_port_forwarding_add_description_Tex: You can add up to 32 port forwarding rules.
help_port_forwarding_add_service_type_gu: Service Type: Provides a list of applications that use the specified ports. The port number will be automatically populated when you select an application. If the service to add is not on the list, manually enter the service name and specify the local and external ports.
help_port_forwarding_add_ip_addr_guide: IP Address: Enter the internal IP address of the device for port forwarding.
help_port_forwarding_add_local_port_guid: Local Port (Start – End): Enter the port to be open on the device for port forwarding. You can enter a number between 1 and 65535.
help_port_forwarding_add_external_port_g: External Port (Start – End): Enter the port number for external access requests. You can enter a number between 1 and 65535.
help_port_forwarding_caution_text: (Caution! To avoid security issues, do not use frequently used, well-known ports, such as port 21 [FTP] and port 80 [HTTP], as the external ports. Also, the ranges of the local and external ports must be set identically.)
help_port_triggering_description_text: Port triggering allows you to control communication between the internal IP network and external host devices.
help_port_triggering_on_off_guide: On/Off: Enable (On) or disable (Off) the port triggering rules on the list. Rules that are disabled (set to “Off”) will not be used.
help_port_triggering_description_guide: Description: Description about the port triggering rules.
help_port_triggering_trigger_range_guide: Trigger Range (Start-End): Displays the range of ports for triggering.
help_port_triggering_trigger_protocol_gu: Protocol: Displays the protocol of the ports for triggering.
help_port_triggering_transmission_range_: Transmission Range (Start-End): Displays the port range for the transmission.
help_port_triggering_edit_delete_guide: Edit/Delete: Edit or delete the port triggering rules on the list.
help_port_triggering_add_description_gui: Description: Enter description for the port triggering rules.
help_port_triggering_add_trigger_range_g: Trigger Range (Start-End): Set the range of ports for triggering. You can enter a number between 1 and 65535.
help_port_triggering_add_trigger_protoco: Protocol: Select protocol of the ports for triggering.
help_port_triggering_add_transmission_gu:
Transmission range (Start-End): Displays the port range for the transmission.
You can enter a number between 1 and 65535.
help_port_triggering_add_transmission_pr: Protocol: Select protocol of the ports for transmission.
help_port_triggering_add_edit_delete_gui: Edit/Delete: Edit or delete the port triggering rules on the list.
help_port_triggering_caution_msg_1: - To avoid security issues, do not use frequently used, well-known ports, such as port 21 (FTP) and port 80 (HTTP), as the external ports.
help_port_triggering_caution_msg_2: - The ranges of the local and external ports must be set identically.
help_dmz_description_text: DMZ may be configured to forward all external access to a single device. This special feature directs all external connection through any port to a single specific IP address, which can be configured by keeping all ports open. Set this feature to “On” to enable it.
help_dmz_caution_text: Caution! The DMZ feature can be vulnerable to security breaches because it allows all external connections. Port setting for DMZ configuration takes priority if the same port has been configured for port forwarding.
help_dmz_destination_guide: Destination: Enter the IP address for the destination.
help_lan_setting_description_text: Configure the basic settings related to the LAN.
help_lan_setting_ip_addr_guide: IP Address: Set the IP address for the LAN. The system will reset after the setting has been changed.
help_lan_setting_subnet_guide: Subnet Mask: Show the subnet mask of the IP address for the LAN.
help_lan_setting_dhcp_server_guide: DHCP Server: Enable or disable the use of DHCP server. (Caution! Connection to all devices on the network will be lost when you disable the DHCP Server feature.)
help_lan_setting_ip_addr_assign_guide: IP Address Assignment: Set the type of IP address assignment via the DHCP server. When it is set to “Auto,” you can provide only the number of the IP addresses to be assigned, then the IP addresses will be automatically assigned by the server. When it is set to “Manual,” you can configure the starting IP address and the number of IP addresses to be assigned to assign IP addresses within the given range.
help_lan_setting_start_ip_addr_guide: Start IP Address: Set the starting address for the DHCP server to begin assigning IP addresses.
help_lan_setting_client_account_guide: Client Account: Set the maximum number of connected devices. The available number for the maximum connected devices is provided below the setting field.
help_lan_setting_lease_time_guide: Lease Time: Set the time duration for the connected device to stay connected using the assigned IP. The default setting is 24 hours.
help_lan_setting_win_server_guide: WINS Server: Enter the address for the WINS server to notify the DHCPv4 client.
help_reserved_ip_description_text: You can set the DHCP server to assign fixed IP addresses to the registered devices on the list. Click the [Add] button below to register devices to use fixed IP addresses. You can register up to 32 devices.
help_primary_wireless_description_text: Set the basic features of the wireless network.
help_primary_wireless_network_name_guide: Network Name (SSID): Set the name of the wireless network. The name will be displayed on the list of available wireless networks on the device (or a connected device). You can enter up to 32 characters.
help_primary_wireless_security_level_gui: Security: Set the level of security for the wireless network. The default setting (WPA2-PSK) is recommended for network security.
help_primary_wireless_security_level_non: - None: Disable the wireless network security feature. This setting is not recommended because any nearby wireless device may have access to the wireless network.
help_primary_wireless_security_level_wpa: - WPA3-SAE/WPA2-PSK: Automatically selects the WPA2 or WPA3 security feature depending on the connecting wireless device.
help_primary_wireless_encryption_guide: Encryption: Select an encryption type to protect the data of the users who have connected to the wireless network.
help_primary_wireless_caution: (Caution!  The WPS feature is available when the security level has been set to “None,” “WPA2-PSK,” “WPA2/WPA-PSK,” or “WPA3-SAE/WPA2-PSK.” The WPS feature will not be available when the security level has been set to “WPA3-SAE.”)
help_primary_wireless_password_guide: Password: Set the password for the wireless network. Enter 8 – 63 characters for the password. The password setting is not required if the security level has been set to “None.”
help_primary_wireless_hide_sside_guide: Hide SSID: This feature hides the network name from the list of available wireless networks on other devices. This feature is not recommended unless it is necessary for security reasons.
help_primary_wireless_internet_only_guid: Internet Only: Set accessibility to the internal network. When it is set to “On,” devices connected to the subnetwork can access the Internet but cannot access the web UI and internal network. Set this feature to “On” to secure the internal network.
help_primary_wireless_ap_isolation_guide: AP Isolation: The AP Isolation is a feature that enables you to create a separate virtual network for each wireless client that is connected to a network name or SSID. When this feature is enabled, all wireless devices in the network will not be able to communicate with each other, preventing unwanted hacking.
help_primary_wireless_mac_access_control: MAC Access Control: Enable or disable MAC Access Control. When it is set to “On,” network access will not be available for all devices other than those listed on the MAC access control list (Wireless > MAC Access Control).
help_primary_wireless_easy_way_to_text: Easy way to access the wireless network
help_primary_wireless_easy_way_to_descri: Click the [Generate QR Code] button to generate a QR code on the right side. Users can scan the QR code on their mobile devices to instantly connect to the wireless network. This feature may not be available depending on the user’s mobile device model.
help_primary_wireless_note_msg_1: 1. This feature is not available  if the Radio feature is set to “Off” in the wireless network settings (Wireless > Basic Setting).
help_primary_wireless_note_msg_2: 2. Settings on the 2.4GHz and 5GHz tabs cannot be individually modified if the Band Steering feature is set to “On.”
help_primary_wireless_band_steering_desc: This feature provides a wireless network connection via an optimal channel by incorporating the 2.4GHz and 5GHz wireless networks into one network name.
help_primary_wireless_band_steering_on_o: Band Steering On/Off: Enable or disable the Band Steering feature.
help_primary_wireless_qr_code_guide: Settings for Network Name (SSID), Security Level, Encryption, Password, Hide SSID, Internet Only, AP Isolation, MAC Access Control, and Generate QR Code features are identical to the 2.4GHz and 5GHz wireless network settings.
help_secondary_wireless_description_text: Provide a separate wireless network for temporary visitors. Using this feature, you can protect the router from threats by malware and viruses by limiting unnecessary access permissions for visitors.
help_secondary_wireless_description_note: (Note: The secondary wireless network is not available if you disable this feature in the settings [Advanced Settings > Wireless Settings].)
help_secondary_wireless_network_name_gui: Network Name (SSID): Set the name of the secondary wireless network.
help_secondary_wireless_security_level_g: Security: Set to “WPA3-SAE/WPA2-PSK” by default. The default setting is recommended for network security.
help_secondary_wireless_security_level_n: - None: Disable the wireless network security feature. This setting is not recommended because any nearby wireless device may have access to the wireless network.
help_secondary_wireless_security_level_w: - WPA2-PSK: A security feature utilizing PSK encryption.
- WPA2/WPA-PSK: Automatically selects WPA or WPA2 security feature depending on the connecting wireless device.
- WPA3-SAE: A security feature utilizing SAE encryption.
- WPA3-SAE/WPA2-PSK: Automatically selects the WPA2 or WPA3 security feature depending on the connecting wireless device.
help_secondary_wireless_encryption_guide: Encryption: Select an encryption type to protect the data of the users who have connected to the wireless network.
help_secondary_wireless_aes_guide: - AES encryption type is used if the security level has been set to “WPA2-PSK” or “WPA3-SAE/WPA2-PSK.”
help_secondary_wireless_aes_tkip_guide: - AES or TKIP encryption type is automatically selected depending on the connecting wireless device if the security level has been set to 'WPA2/WPA-PSK.'
help_secondary_wireless_caution: (Caution!  The WPS feature is available when the security level has been set to “None,” “WPA2-PSK,” “WPA2/WPA-PSK,” or “WPA3-SAE/WPA2-PSK.” The WPS feature will not be available when the security level has been set to “WPA3-SAE.”)
help_secondary_wireless_hide_ssid_guide: Hide SSID: This feature hides the network name from the list of available wireless networks on other devices. This feature is not recommended unless it is necessary for security reasons.
help_secondary_wireless_internet_only_gu: Internet Only: Set accessibility to internal network. When it is set to “On,” devices connected to the subnetwork can access the Internet but cannot access the web UI and internal network. Set this feature to “On” to secure the internal network.
help_secondary_wireless_mac_access_contr: MAC Access Control: Enable or disable MAC Access Control. When it is set to “On,” network access will not be available for all devices other than those listed on the MAC access control list (Wireless > MAC Access Control).
help_mac_access_control_description_text: The list of MAC addresses are displayed for the wireless devices that are allowed to access the network. Click the [Add] button below to register a new device. You can register up to 32 devices.
help_mac_access_control_mac_addr_device_: MAC Address/Device Name: Specify the devices that are allowed to access the network. You can select the currently connected or previously connected devices from the list of devices. If the device is not on the list, you can manually enter the MAC address to register the device.
help_internet_setting_pppoe_service_desc: Set up the PPPoE service provided by your ISP.
help_internet_setting_username_guide: User Name, Password: Enter the user name and password provided by the ISP.
help_internet_setting_manual_dns_guide: Manual DNS: Set whether to use Manual DNS. If set to 'On', DNS server address 1/2 can be entered directly.
help_internet_setting_dns_server1_guide: DNS Server 1: Sets the primary DNS server.
help_internet_setting_dns_server2_guide: DNS Server 2: Sets the secondary DNS server.
help_internet_setting_connection_mode_gu: Connection Mode: Set the connection type of PPPoE.
help_internet_setting_authentication_typ: Authentication Type: Set the authentication type of PPPoE connection.
help_internet_setting_ppp_keep_alive_gui: PPP Keep Alive: Configure settings for PPP Keep Alive.
help_internet_setting_ppp_echo_interval_: PPP Echo Interval: Enter the transmission interval time of the packets to be sent to check the PPP connection status. You can enter a value between 1 and 255 seconds.
help_internet_setting_ppp_echo_retry_int: PPP Echo Retry Interval: If there is no response to the packet, enter the time interval to send the same packet. You can enter a value from 1 to 255 seconds.
help_internet_setting_ppp_echo_retry_cou: PPP Echo Retry Count: If there is no response to the packet, enter the number of times to send the same packet. You can enter a value from 1 to 255.
help_internet_setting_ipv6_guide: IPv6: Enable (On) or disable (Off) the IPv6 WAN side. Rules that are disabled (set to “Off”) will not be used.
help_internet_setting_isp_guide: - Most ISPs utilize MAC addresses for Internet connection. When your router is connected to the Internet for the first time, the ISP may not be able to identify your router. the “Clone MAC Address” feature is used to copy the MAC address of a PC connected to the Internet to connect your router to the Internet.
help_internet_setting_manually_clone_mac: - You can manually enter the MAC address or enable the “Clone MAC Address” feature (set it to “On”) to display and copy the MAC address.
help_home_description_text:
Home screen displays network connection information and devices connected to the router.
Each card displays the settings for related items.
help_information_model_name_guide: Model Name: Model name of the router.
help_information_serial_number_guide: Serial Number: Unique ID number of the router.
help_information_firmware_version_guide: Firmware Version: Version of the current firmware.
help_information_operation_time_guide: Operation Time: Total operation time of the router after it has been turned on or reset. The operation time will be initialized after a power off, factory reset, or restart.
help_information_mac_addr_guide: MAC Address: Physical IP address for WAN (BASE).
help_internet_description_text: View the Internet connection status of the router. Click the tab to view the information.
help_internet_ipv4_wan_type_guide: WAN Type: Displays status and type of Internet connection in use.
help_internet_ipv4_wan_ip_addr_guide: WAN IP address: IPv4 address for the current WAN.
help_internet_ipv4_subnet_mask_guide: Subnet Mask: Subnet mask for WAN IPv4 address.
help_internet_ipv4_gateway_guide: Gateway: Gateway address for WAN IPv4 address.
help_internet_ipv4_dns_server_guide: DNS Server 1/ DNS Server 2: DNS server address 1/2 of IPv6.
help_internet_ipv4_mac_addr_guide: MAC Address: Physical IPv4 address for the WAN.
help_internet_ipv6_wan_type_guide: WAN IPv6 Type: Displays status and type of Internet connection in use.
help_internet_ipv6_wan_ip_addr_guide: WAN IPv6 Address: IPv6 address for the current WAN.
help_internet_ipv6_prefix_guide: Prefix: Prefix value of WAN IPv6 address.
help_internet_ipv6_dns_server_guide: DNS Server 1/ DNS Server 2: DNS server address 1/2 of IPv6.
help_internet_ipv6_mac_addr_guide: MAC Address: Physical IPv6 address for the WAN.
help_lan_description_text: View the local area network (LAN) information.
help_lan_ipv4_lan_ip_addr_guide: LAN IP Address: IP address for the current LAN.
help_lan_ipv4_dhcp_server_guide: DHCP Server: Shows whether or not the DHCP server is in use.
help_lan_ipv4_ip_addr_assignment_guide: IP Address Assignment: The type of IP address assignment in use.
help_lan_ipv4_client_account_guide: Client Account: The maximum number of IP addresses that can be assigned.
help_lan_ipv4_mac_addr_guide: MAC Address: Physical address of IPv4 for the LAN.
help_lan_ipv6_type_guide: LAN IPv6 Type: Displays the type of IPv6 for the LAN.
help_lan_ipv6_addr_guide: LAN IPv6 Address: Displays the IPv6 address for the LAN.
help_lan_ipv6_prefix_guide: IPv6 Prefix Length: Prefix length of the IPv6 for the LAN.
help_lan_ipv6_mac_addr_guide: MAC Address: Physical IPv6 address for the LAN.
help_wireless_setting_description_text: View the wireless network information. (Note: For basic wireless settings, go to Wireless > Primary Wireless. For advanced wireless settings, go to Advanced > Wireless.)
help_wireless_setting_network_name_guide: Network Name (SSID): Name of the current primary wireless network.
help_wireless_setting_security_guide: Security: Type of security for the current primary wireless network. Default setting is “WPA2-PSK” The default setting is recommended for network security.
help_wireless_setting_password_guide: Password: Password for the current network name (SSID). You can click the icon (eye symbol) on the right to view the password.
help_wireless_setting_mac_addr_guide: MAC Address: Physical address for the primary wireless network.
help_internet_link_status_description_te: Displays the link status and speed of the connected Ethernet ports (WAN (PON), LAN 1,2,3,4 ports).
help_internet_link_status_wan_guide: WAN(PON): Display the status of the WAN(PON) interface.
help_internet_link_status_lan1_guide: LAN Port 1: Display the status of the LAN Port 1 interface.
help_internet_link_status_lan2_guide: LAN Port 2: Display the status of the LAN Port 2 interface.
help_internet_link_status_lan3_guide: LAN Port 3: Display the status of the LAN Port 3 interface.
help_internet_link_status_lan4_guide: LAN Port 4: Display the status of the LAN Port 4 interface.
help_connected_devices_description_text: View information about the devices connected to the router.
help_connected_devices_device_name_guide: Device Name: Name of the connected device.
help_connected_devices_interface_guide: Interface: Connection Interface type of the connected device.
help_connected_devices_interface_lan: - LAN 1 – 4: Devices that are connected to LAN ports 1 – 4
help_connected_devices_interface_24g: - 2.4GHz: Devices connected to the 2.4GHz primary network
help_connected_devices_interface_5g: - 5GHz: Devices connected to the 5GHz primary network
help_connected_devices_interface_24g_sec: - 2.4GHz-Secondary: Devices connected to the 2.4GHz secondary network
help_connected_devices_interface_5g_seco: - 5GHz-Secondary: Devices connected to the 5GHz secondary network
help_connected_devices_mac_addr_guide: MAC Address: Physical address of the connected device.
help_connected_devices_ip_addr_guide: IP Address: IP address used by the connected device.
common_wireless_radio_turn_off_message:
Wireless {{interface}} is turned off.
If you want to use it, please go to the Advanced Setting > Wireless and turn on Radio
wps_generate_router_pin_number_msg: If your client device asks for the router's PIN, click the Generate button below and enter the number to the client device.
wps_enter_device_pin_number_msg: If your client device has a Wi-Fi Protected Setup PIN, enter the number and click the Register button below.
common_ui_dialog_auto_session_expired: Your session has been expired. Please log in again.
common_ui_dialog_not_implemented: The requested operation has not been implemented.
primary_wireless_bs_steering_tooltip_msg: Band Steering is a feature that shares the same wireless settings, allowing clients to connect to the optimal band.
advanced_wireless_page_confirm_turn_off_: You cannot use 5GHz wireless network. All wireless-related functions (WPS, Band Steering, MAC Access Control etc.) cannot be used. Continue?
You cannot use 2.4GHz wireless network. All wireless-related functions (WPS, Band Steering, MAC Access Control etc.) cannot be used. Continue?
common_ui_select_or_enter_the_server_typ: Select or enter a service type.
help_internet_setting_connection_name_gu: Connection Name: Enter the description of this WAN connection.
help_home_lan_link_local_address_guide: LAN Link-Local Address: This is for LAN Link Local IPv6 address.
help_internet_setting_alway_on_guide: - Always On: Always maintain PPP connection.
help_internet_setting_on_demand_guide: - On Demand: Maintain/release the PPP connection according to user's choice.
help_internet_setting_alway_off_guide: - Always Off: Always release PPP connection except PPPoe Bridge.
help_internet_setting_ppoe_bridge_guide: PPPoE Bridge: Enable (On) or disable (Off) the PPPoE Bridge.
help_wireless_setting_band_steering_enab: Band Steering (Enabled) : It shows the status of band steering.
wireless_primary_wireless_notify_when_se: If security set to WPA3-SAE, WPS function is disabled, and only clients supporting WPA3-SAE can access it. Continue?
help_advanced_routing_ipv4_destination: Destination IP Address: Set the destination IP address to which the routing rules apply.
help_advanced_routing_subnet_mask: Subnet Mask: Set the subnet mask to which the routing rules apply.
help_advanced_routing_Interface: Interface: Set the interface to which the routing rules apply.
help_advanced_routing_gateway: Gateway: Set the gateway to which the routing rules apply.
help_advanced_routing_ipv6_destination: Destination IP Address : Set the destination IPv6 address to which the routing rules apply.
help_advanced_routing_ipv6_link_local_ad: Link Local Address: Set the link local address to which the routing rules apply.
help_advanced_routing_ipv6_Interface: Interface: Set the interface to which the routing rules apply.
help_packet_filtering_add_guide: You can register up to 32 devices.
help_packet_filtering_add_type: Type: Set blocking / release for packets matching the filter condition.
help_packet_filtering_add_target_interfa: Target Interface: Set the direction in which the set packet is delivered.
help_packet_filtering_add_protocol: <b>Protocol: Select the type of IP protocol to be filtered.
help_packet_filtering_add_source_address: Source Address Type and IP Address : Select the type of source IP address to be filtered. Enter the appropriate IP Address value according to the selected value.
help_packet_filtering_add_source_port: Source Port (Start – End): Enter the start/end source port to be filtered. Check “Any” to perform filtering on all port number packets.
help_packet_filtering_add_destination_ad: Destination Address Type and IP Address : Select the type of destination IP address to be filtered. Enter the appropriate IP Address value according to the selected value.
help_packet_filtering_add_destination_po: Destination Port (Start – End): Displays the target port number of the packets to be filtered. Check “Any” to perform filtering on all port number packets.
help_packet_filtering_add_priority: Priority: Enter the priority of the IPv4 (or IPv6) filtering conditions. You can enter a value from 1 to 32.
help_advanced_diagnostic_view_result: Click the [Start] button to view the result below. You can click the [Clear] button to delete the result.
help_pon_status_input_power: Input(Rx) Power: Display the status of Input power.
help_pon_status_output_power: Output(Rx) Power: Display the status of output power.
help_pon_status_supply_voltage: Suply Voltage: Display the status of suply voltage.
help_pon_status_transmitter: Transmitter bias current: Display transmitter bias current value.
help_wireless_select_channel: Selecting channel range(s)(5GHz): Set the channel range(s) when the channel is Auto.
advanced_wireless_search_target_channel_: At least one of the target search groups must be checked.
primary_wireless_page_confirm_turn_off_r:
You cannot use {{interface}} Primary Wireless network.
All wireless-related functions (WPS, Band Steering, MAC Access Control etc.) cannot be used. Continue?
secondary_wireless_page_confirm_turn_off:
You cannot use {{interface}} Secondary Wireless network.
All wireless-related functions (WPS, MAC Access Control etc.) cannot be used. Continue?
basic_wireless_page_confirm_turn_off_rad: You cannot use {{interface}} wireless network. All wireless-related functions (WPS, Band Steering, MAC Access Control etc.) cannot be used. Continue?
help_log_analysis_save_button_guide: You can download a log file if you click [Save] button.
page_error_duplicate_ip_destination_link:
The Destination IP Address cannot be the same as the link local address.
Enter another address.
help_network_ip_spoofing_blocking_guide: IP Spoofing Blocking: Blocking IP spoofing packets from WAN.
help_advanced_routing_ipv6_length: Prefix Length: Set the prefix length to which the routing rules apply.
common_text_dialog_confirm_restart: Do you want to restart the system? It take about a few minutes to restart and the phone cannot be used during the reboot. Continue?
common_subtext_dialog_confirm_restart: * Depending on the device, the restart may not be executed.
wireless_page_radio_description_mesh_on: * Cannot be turned off while using the mesh function.
